title.narrative: Somalia Recurrent Cost & Reform Financing Project - Phase 2

description.narrative: The development objective of the Second Phase of the Recurrent Cost and Reform Financing Project for Somalia is to enable the Somali Government to achieve reliable and transparent financing of critical civil service operations to help strengthen the legitimacy of the state. The project comprises of four components. The first component, support to core government functions of ministries, departments, and agencies (MDAs) in Federal Government of Somalia (FGS) will finance: the salaries of eligible non-security sector civil servants in the MDAs; the cost of staff injected under the capacity injection mechanism (CIM); and non-salary operating costs for MDAs. It consists of following three sub-components: (i) financing of eligible civil service salaries in non-security sectors in FGS; (ii) financing of salaries and allowances to government staff and young graduates recruited under the capacity injection mechanism (CIM) in FGS; and (iii) financing of eligible non-salary recurrent costs in MDA in the FGS. The second component is inter-governmental fiscal transfers to core government functions of eligible federal member states, interim, and emerging administrations. It consists of following two sub-components: (i) transfers to interim and emerging states for core government functions; and (ii) inter-governmental fora on transfers and information exchanges. The third component, support of recurrent costs in health and education sectors in FGS and eligible member states, interim, and emerging administrations will support the FGS, Puntland, and interim Jubba administration (IJA) to expand their service delivery systems through improvement of accountability systems and support of recurrent costs in the education and health sectors. The fourth component, project management and coordination will support coordination, administration, communication, management, procurement, monitorin

condition.narrative: Schedule 2 Section I.B.1: The Recipient shall not later than thirty (45) days after the Signature Date, update the ProjectOperations Manual, in form and substance satisfactory to the World Bank

baseline.value: 2018 fiscal transfers to FMS budgeted at USD 12m, with USD 5.4m for block transfers under Ministry of Interior and Federal Affairs

target.value: FGS fiscal transfers execution rate to FMS equal to or greater than the outturn rate for domestic revenues (Year 3)

actual.value: Met. Execution rate for fiscal transfers to FMS for the months (Jan-June) of 2020 is 75% exceeds execution rate for domesticrevenue for at 45% of budgeted level

title.narrative: Women of child bearing age (15-59 years) and children 0-59 months referred to health facilities by Female Health Workers
Female Health Workers selected according to guidelines, trained, and actively providing services
Eligible FMS/BRA conducting proficiency testing of teachers as an annual exercise establishing minimum competency level of teachers(DLI 7)
Monthly payroll reports published on MOF website
Share of civil servants' salaries financed by government
Percentage of eligible civil servants salaries paid on time
Strengthened payment process for operational expenditures (DLI 4) (Percent)

baseline.value: Cash advances to MDAs 50% of operating expenditures.

target.value: All government payments for salaries, transfers and capital expenditures to be executed as payments to Bank accounts directly tovendors, with the exception of: petty cash, travel advances, security sector and contingency (per Appropriation Act)

actual.value: Cash advances are progressing to MDAs with 9.8% of operating expenses

baseline.value: Lack of a coherent system for school supervision, with inadequate financing to enable FMS education ministries to fulfil thisfunction

target.value: Satisfactory completion of full round of supervision activities in eligible FMS

actual.value: Five states(PSS, HSS, GSS, JSS, SWSS) and Banaadir region developed supervision costed school supervision operational plans,checklists and tools. 1,554 primary and secondary schools were visited between Nov 2019 to April 2020

title.narrative: Contract Management Unit established and fully staffed according to organogram
